<h2 id="mp-tfa-h2" class="mp-h2 mw-html-heading">From today's featured article</h2>
<div id="mp-tfa" class="mp-contains-float"><div id="mp-tfa-img" style="float: left; margin: 0.5em 0.9em 0.4em 0em;">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; color: inherit; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 170px;">
<span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Berners_Street_Hoax_caricature.jpg" class="mw-file-description" title="Caricature of the Berners Street hoax by William Heath"><img alt="Caricature of the Berners Street hoax by William Heath" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Berners_Street_Hoax_caricature.jpg/250px-Berners_Street_Hoax_caricature.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="116" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Berners_Street_Hoax_caricature.jpg/330px-Berners_Street_Hoax_caricature.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a7/Berners_Street_Hoax_caricature.jpg/500px-Berners_Street_Hoax_caricature.jpg 2x" data-file-width="750" data-file-height="510"></a></span><div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Caricature of the Berners Street hoax by <a href="/wiki/William_Heath_(artist)" title="William Heath (artist)">William Heath</a></div></div>
</div>
<p>The <b><a href="/wiki/Berners_Street_hoax" title="Berners Street hoax">Berners Street hoax</a></b> was perpetrated by the writer <a href="/wiki/Theodore_Hook" title="Theodore Hook">Theodore Hook</a> in London in 1810. He made a bet that he could transform any property into the most talked-about address in London. He spent six weeks sending between 1000 and 4000 letters to tradespeople and businesses ordering deliveries of their goods and services to 54 <a href="/wiki/Berners_Street" title="Berners Street">Berners Street</a>, London, at various times on the same day. Several well-known people were also invited to call on the address, including the chairmen of the <a href="/wiki/Bank_of_England" title="Bank of England">Bank of England</a> and the <a href="/wiki/East_India_Company" title="East India Company">East India Company</a>, <a href="/wiki/Prince_William_Frederick,_Duke_of_Gloucester_and_Edinburgh" title="Prince William Frederick, Duke of Gloucester and Edinburgh">the Duke of Gloucester</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/Lord_Mayor_of_London" title="Lord Mayor of London">Lord Mayor of London</a>. <a href="/wiki/Chimney_sweep" title="Chimney sweep">Chimney sweeps</a> began arriving at the address at 5:00 am on the day, followed by hundreds of traders and businessmen; goods deliveries included <a href="/wiki/Organ_(music)" title="Organ (music)">organs</a>, furniture, coal and a coffin. The police were not able to clear the street until after the final influx of visitors at 5:00 pm. Hook was unidentified at the time, but admitted his involvement in a semi-autobiographical novel published twenty-five years later. (<b><a href="/wiki/Berners_Street_hoax" title="Berners Street hoax">Full article...</a></b>)
</p>

<h2 id="mp-dyk-h2" class="mp-h2 mw-html-heading">Did you know ...</h2>
<div id="mp-dyk" class="mp-contains-float">
<div class="dyk-img" style="float: right; margin-left: 0.5em;">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; color: inherit; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 142px;">
<span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Siege_of_Shaizar_(1157).jpg" class="mw-file-description" title="Miniature depiction of the siege of Shaizar"><img alt="Miniature depiction of the siege of Shaizar" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Siege_of_Shaizar_%281157%29.jpg/250px-Siege_of_Shaizar_%281157%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="142" height="138" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Siege_of_Shaizar_%281157%29.jpg/330px-Siege_of_Shaizar_%281157%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1068" data-file-height="1039"></a></span><div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Miniature depiction of the siege of Shaizar</div></div>
</div>
<ul><li>... that after an earthquake wiped out <a href="/wiki/Shaizar" title="Shaizar">Shaizar</a>'s ruling family, crusaders <b><a href="/wiki/Siege_of_Shaizar_(1157)" title="Siege of Shaizar (1157)">tried to seize the city</a></b> <i>(pictured)</i> but quarreled and left?</li>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Anacaona" title="Anacaona">Anacaona</a></b> was the subject of a popular <a href="/wiki/Salsa_music" title="Salsa music">salsa</a> song centuries after her death?</li>
<li>... that the song "<b><a href="/wiki/Michelle_Pfeiffer_(Ethel_Cain_song)" title="Michelle Pfeiffer (Ethel Cain song)">Michelle Pfeiffer</a></b>" has been described as possessing "a cresting emotionality grand enough to fill the tallest IMAX screen"?</li>
<li>... that the printed edition of the <i><b><a href="/wiki/Woodstock_Letters" title="Woodstock Letters">Woodstock Letters</a></b></i> runs almost 50,000 pages, covering nearly 13 feet (4 metres) of shelving?</li>
<li>... that some <a href="/wiki/Exoplanet" title="Exoplanet">exoplanets</a> are <b><a href="/wiki/Catastrophically_evaporating_planet" title="Catastrophically evaporating planet">evaporating catastrophically</a></b>?</li>
<li>... that 11 of the <b><a href="/wiki/List_of_Italian_generals_who_died_during_the_First_World_War" title="List of Italian generals who died during the First World War">27 Italian generals who died during the First World War</a></b> perished during the last six months?</li>
<li>... that American football kicker <b><a href="/wiki/Brian_Hall_(American_football)" title="Brian Hall (American football)">Brian Hall</a></b> used a prosthetic leg?</li>
<li>... that <a href="/wiki/Jacqueline_Wilson" title="Jacqueline Wilson">Jacqueline Wilson</a> worked with <a href="/wiki/Disability_Rights_UK" title="Disability Rights UK">Disability Rights UK</a> when writing <i><b><a href="/wiki/The_Best_Sleepover_in_the_World" title="The Best Sleepover in the World">The Best Sleepover in the World</a></b></i><span style="padding-left:0.15em;">?</span></li>
<li>... that <b><a href="/wiki/Laila_Friis-Salling" title="Laila Friis-Salling">Laila Friis-Salling</a></b> took up skiing due to a bet?</li></ul>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/2025_Ghanaian_Air_Force_Z-9_helicopter_crash" title="2025 Ghanaian Air Force Z-9 helicopter crash">A helicopter crashes</a></b> in <a href="/wiki/Ashanti_Region" title="Ashanti Region">Ashanti Region</a>, Ghana, killing all on board, including two current ministers (<a href="/wiki/Edward_Omane_Boamah" title="Edward Omane Boamah">Edward Omane Boamah</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ibrahim_Murtala_Muhammed" title="Ibrahim Murtala Muhammed">Ibrahim Murtala Muhammed</a>).</li>

<h2 id="mp-otd-h2" class="mp-h2 mw-html-heading">On this day</h2>
<div id="mp-otd" class="mp-contains-float">
<p><b><a href="/wiki/August_11" title="August 11">August 11</a></b>
</p>
<div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em;" id="mp-otd-img">
<div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; color: inherit; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 190px;">
<span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:1975_Ford_Pinto_Runabout_2.8V6,_front_right_(blue).jpg" class="mw-file-description" title="1975 Ford Pinto"><img alt="1975 Ford Pinto" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/1975_Ford_Pinto_Runabout_2.8V6%2C_front_right_%28blue%29.jpg/250px-1975_Ford_Pinto_Runabout_2.8V6%2C_front_right_%28blue%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="103" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/1975_Ford_Pinto_Runabout_2.8V6%2C_front_right_%28blue%29.jpg/330px-1975_Ford_Pinto_Runabout_2.8V6%2C_front_right_%28blue%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/1975_Ford_Pinto_Runabout_2.8V6%2C_front_right_%28blue%29.jpg/500px-1975_Ford_Pinto_Runabout_2.8V6%2C_front_right_%28blue%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5344" data-file-height="2892"></a></span><div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">1975 Ford Pinto</div></div>
</div>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/AD_106" title="AD 106">106</a>  The region of <b><a href="/wiki/Roman_Dacia" title="Roman Dacia">Dacia</a></b>, comprising parts of modern Romania, became a <a href="/wiki/Roman_province" title="Roman province">province of the Roman Empire</a>.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/1952" title="1952">1952</a>  King <a href="/wiki/Talal_of_Jordan" title="Talal of Jordan">Talal of Jordan</a> was forced to abdicate due to mental illness and was succeeded by his eldest son <b><a href="/wiki/Hussein_of_Jordan" title="Hussein of Jordan">Hussein</a></b>.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/1975" title="1975">1975</a>  The <a href="/wiki/Timorese_Democratic_Union" title="Timorese Democratic Union">Timorese Democratic Union</a> launches a coup in <a href="/wiki/Portuguese_Timor" title="Portuguese Timor">Portuguese Timor</a>, starting the <b><a href="/wiki/East_Timorese_civil_war" title="East Timorese civil war">East Timorese civil war</a></b>.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/1977" title="1977">1977</a>  The U.S. <a href="/wiki/National_Highway_Traffic_Safety_Administration" title="National Highway Traffic Safety Administration">National Highway Traffic Safety Administration</a> initiated an investigation into the alleged vulnerability of the <b><a href="/wiki/Ford_Pinto" title="Ford Pinto">Ford Pinto</a></b> <i>(example pictured)</i> to fuel leakage and fire in a rear-end collision.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/1999" title="1999">1999</a>  The <b><a href="/wiki/1999_Salt_Lake_City_tornado" title="1999 Salt Lake City tornado">Salt Lake City Tornado</a></b> hit downtown <a href="/wiki/Salt_Lake_City" title="Salt Lake City">Salt Lake City</a>, damaging 120 homes and injuring over 100 people.</li></ul>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374"><div class="hlist" style="margin-top: 0.5em;"><ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Guttorm_of_Norway" title="Guttorm of Norway">Guttorm of Norway</a></b>  (<abbr title="died">d.</abbr> 1204)</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Wanda_Weso%C5%82owska" title="Wanda Wesoowska">Wanda Wesoowska</a></b>  (<abbr title="born">b.</abbr> 1950)</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Steve_Wozniak" title="Steve Wozniak">Steve Wozniak</a></b>  (<abbr title="born">b.</abbr> 1950)</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Robin_Williams" title="Robin Williams">Robin Williams</a></b>  (<abbr title="died">d.</abbr> 2014)</li></ul></div>

<h2 id="mp-tfl-h2" class="mp-h2 mw-html-heading">From today's featured list</h2>
<div id="mp-tfl" class="mp-contains-float"><div id="mp-tfl-img" style="float:right;margin:0.5em 0 0.4em 0.9em;"><div class="thumbinner mp-thumb" style="background: transparent; color: inherit; border: none; padding: 0; max-width: 171px;">
<span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:TataSteelChess2018-1.jpg" class="mw-file-description" title="Playing hall of the 80th Tata Steel Tournament, 2018"><img alt="Playing hall of the 80th Tata Steel Tournament, 2018" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/95/TataSteelChess2018-1.jpg/250px-TataSteelChess2018-1.jpg" decoding="async" width="171" height="114" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/95/TataSteelChess2018-1.jpg/330px-TataSteelChess2018-1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/95/TataSteelChess2018-1.jpg/500px-TataSteelChess2018-1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5472" data-file-height="3648"></a></span><div class="thumbcaption" style="padding: 0.25em 0; word-wrap: break-word;">Playing hall of the 80th Tata Steel Tournament, 2018</div></div>
</div>
<p>The <b><a href="/wiki/Tata_Steel_Chess_Tournament" title="Tata Steel Chess Tournament">Tata Steel Chess Tournament</a></b> is an annual chess tournament held in January in <a href="/wiki/Wijk_aan_Zee" title="Wijk aan Zee">Wijk aan Zee</a>, the Netherlands. Top <a href="/wiki/Grandmaster_(chess)" title="Grandmaster (chess)">grandmasters</a> compete in the tournament, but regular club players are welcome to play in the lower groups. The Masters group pits fourteen of the world's best players against each other in a <a href="/wiki/Round-robin_tournament" title="Round-robin tournament">round-robin tournament</a>, and has sometimes been described as the "<a href="/wiki/Wimbledon_Championships" title="Wimbledon Championships">Wimbledon</a> of Chess". Of the fifteen undisputed <a href="/wiki/World_Chess_Championship" title="World Chess Championship">World Chess Champions</a> since the first tournament in 1938, only five have not won it. Magnus Carlsen holds the record for most wins at the tournament, with eight. Viswanathan Anand is the only other player to have won the event five or more times, with five titles to his name. <a href="/wiki/R_Praggnanandhaa" title="R Praggnanandhaa">R Praggnanandhaa</a> is the defending champion after defeating <a href="/wiki/Gukesh_Dommaraju" title="Gukesh Dommaraju">Gukesh Dommaraju</a> in tiebreaks in <a href="/wiki/Tata_Steel_Chess_Tournament_2025" title="Tata Steel Chess Tournament 2025">2025</a>. (<b><a href="/wiki/Tata_Steel_Chess_Tournament" title="Tata Steel Chess Tournament">Full list...</a></b>)
</p>

<h2 id="mp-tfp-h2" class="mp-h2 mw-html-heading">Today's featured picture</h2>
<div id="mp-tfp">
<table role="presentation" style="margin:0 3px 3px; width:100%; box-sizing:border-box; text-align:left; border-collapse:collapse;">
<tbody><tr>
<td style="padding:0 0.9em 0 0; width:400px;"><span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Graceful_Pitta_0A2A8564.jpg" class="mw-file-description" title="Graceful pitta"><img alt="Graceful pitta" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ec/Graceful_Pitta_0A2A8564.jpg/500px-Graceful_Pitta_0A2A8564.jpg" decoding="async" width="400" height="267" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ec/Graceful_Pitta_0A2A8564.jpg/960px-Graceful_Pitta_0A2A8564.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="4349" data-file-height="2899"></a></span>
</td>
<td style="padding:0 6px 0 0">
<p>The <b><a href="/wiki/Graceful_pitta" title="Graceful pitta">graceful pitta</a></b> (<i>Erythropitta venusta</i>) is a species of bird in the family <a href="/wiki/Pitta" title="Pitta">Pittidae</a>. It occurs on the Indonesian island of <a href="/wiki/Sumatra" title="Sumatra">Sumatra</a>, where its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist <a href="/wiki/Montane_ecosystem#Montane_forests" title="Montane ecosystem">montane forests</a>. The graceful pitta has a length of around 18 cm (7.1 in) in length. It is a predominantly black bird with reddish undertones, the bottom of its wings featuring vivid blue stripes while the lower breast and abdomen are crimson. It has a call which has been described as resembling a high-pitched train whistle which remains at a consistent pitch. The graceful pitta is very rare and is at risk and vulnerable. Although it has been legally protected from hunting since 1931, it is threatened by <a href="/wiki/Habitat_destruction" title="Habitat destruction">habitat loss</a> as a result of deforestation. This graceful pitta was photographed in tropical rainforest at Sumatra's <a href="/wiki/Barisan_Mountains" title="Barisan Mountains">Barisan Mountains</a>.
</p>
<p style="text-align:left;"><small>Photograph credit: <a href="/wiki/User:JJ_Harrison" title="User:JJ Harrison">JJ Harrison</a></small></p>

From today's featured article
Caricature of the Berners Street hoax by William Heath

The Berners Street hoax was perpetrated by the writer Theodore Hook in London in 1810. He made a bet that he could transform any property into the most talked-about address in London. He spent six weeks sending between 1000 and 4000 letters to tradespeople and businesses ordering deliveries of their goods and services to 54Berners Street, London, at various times on the same day. Several well-known people were also invited to call on the address, including the chairmen of the Bank of England and the East India Company, the Duke of Gloucester, and the Lord Mayor of London. Chimney sweeps began arriving at the address at 5:00am on the day, followed by hundreds of traders and businessmen; goods deliveries included organs, furniture, coal and a coffin. The police were not able to clear the street until after the final influx of visitors at 5:00pm. Hook was unidentified at the time, but admitted his involvement in a semi-autobiographical novel published twenty-five years later. (Fullarticle...)

From today's featured list
Playing hall of the 80th Tata Steel Tournament, 2018

The Tata Steel Chess Tournament is an annual chess tournament held in January in Wijk aan Zee, the Netherlands. Top grandmasters compete in the tournament, but regular club players are welcome to play in the lower groups. The Masters group pits fourteen of the world's best players against each other in a round-robin tournament, and has sometimes been described as the "Wimbledon of Chess". Of the fifteen undisputed World Chess Champions since the first tournament in 1938, only five have not won it. Magnus Carlsen holds the record for most wins at the tournament, with eight. Viswanathan Anand is the only other player to have won the event five or more times, with five titles to his name. R Praggnanandhaa is the defending champion after defeating Gukesh Dommaraju in tiebreaks in 2025. (Fulllist...)

Today's featured picture
	

The graceful pitta (Erythropitta venusta) is a species of bird in the family Pittidae. It occurs on the Indonesian island of Sumatra, where its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist montane forests. The graceful pitta has a length of around 18 cm (7.1 in) in length. It is a predominantly black bird with reddish undertones, the bottom of its wings featuring vivid blue stripes while the lower breast and abdomen are crimson. It has a call which has been described as resembling a high-pitched train whistle which remains at a consistent pitch. The graceful pitta is very rare and is at risk and vulnerable. Although it has been legally protected from hunting since 1931, it is threatened by habitat loss as a result of deforestation. This graceful pitta was photographed in tropical rainforest at Sumatra's Barisan Mountains.

Photograph credit: JJ Harrison
